title: updatedOSBI investigating deadly shooting in Delaware County
content: OSBI investigating deadly shooting in Delaware County (KTUL)    DELAWARE COUNTY, Okla. (KTUL) —    The Oklahoma State Bureau of Investigation is assisting the Delaware County Sheriff's Office after a deadly shooting near Colcord.    DCSO says the shooting scene traveled from one home to a neighboring home on County Road 670, south of Highway 20.     Investigators say two men entered the home of Dinh Van Hoang where he was shot and killed.     OSBI says two suspects left Hoang’s home and later fired shots at Robbie Kirby’s vehicle. They say Kirby was struck multiple times and was transported to a Tulsa hospital in stable condition.    Deputies believe, at one point, the two victims hopped into a car to escape two suspects who were shooting at them.    DCSO names Waylon and Willie Russell as the two shooting suspects.    They were taken into custody on complaints of first-degree murder and shooting with intent to kill.
